business.headline: India set to keep some agriculture protections under US deal: Trump's trade chiefThe Trump administration is finalising the India trade deal, which will cut India's tariffs on US industrial goods from 13.5% to zero while allowing New Delhi to retain some protections on agricultural imports, US Trade Representative Jamieson Greer said.

Which products Americans are searching amid India-US trade dealIndian textiles, diamonds and jewellery dominate exports globally, but American interest appears to rest with a far smaller commodity, a tiny crustacean.

Sensex ends 2,000 points higher: Here's why the stock market jumped todayThe S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,072.67 points to close at 83,739.13, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 639.15 points to settle at 25,727.55. The Nifty recorded its best single-day gain since May 2025, showing a strong return of buying interest after recent weakness.

Gold and silver ETFs surge again after three-day slump. What changed today?Gold and silver may stay volatile in the near term, but today's bounce shows investors are still willing to buy dips. Whether the recovery holds will depend on global cues and key support levels.

Did you miss the India-US trade deal stock market rally? Here's what to doEarly signs of the rally were visible even before Indian markets opened. Gift Nifty jumped more than 700 points after the trade deal announcement, signalling a strong start for Dalal Street.

India–US trade deal and the big oil question: What's changing for India?India became one of the largest buyers of discounted Russian crude after 2022, a trend that helped reduce its import bill. US President Donald Trump's announcement indicates that these purchases will eventually decline, but the immediate impact is expected to be limited.

India–US trade deal announced, but why the fine print remains crucialUS President Donald Trump called the changes "effective immediately" on Truth Social, and Prime Minister Narendra Modi confirmed the development shortly afterward. Yet the absence of the actual agreement means much of the deal is being read between the lines rather than from a published document.

Silver, gold rates today: Why prices are rising after recent crashOn the Multi Commodity Exchange, silver prices jumped sharply, while gold also posted strong gains in early trade. MCX silver was trading around Rs 2,53,792 per kg, up Rs 17,531 or 7.42% as of 10 am. MCX gold was near Rs 1,49,101 per 10 grams, higher by Rs 5,110 or 3.55%.

Adani Enterprises stock surges 10% on India–US trade deal. Check top gainersThe India–US trade deal has supercharged sentiment, lifting Adani stocks and other heavyweights sharply. Here's a look at the top gainers as markets rally hard after the landmark announcement.

India-US trade deal: Why it's good news for Sensex, Nifty and the rupeeThe India–US trade deal lifts a long-standing weight off investors' shoulders, giving the Sensex, Nifty and the rupee a cleaner runway. With clarity finally restored, the market's next leg higher suddenly looks more believable.

Sensex jumps 2,500 points: 3 reasons why the stock market is rising today?The S&P BSE Sensex jumped 2,271.45 points to 83,937.54, while the NSE Nifty50 climbed 691.70 points to 25,780.10 as of 9:28 am. The sharp rise came as investors reacted to clarity on the India-US trade agreement, which had remained delayed for months and was seen as a key reason behind recent market weakness.

Did India really commit $500 billion to the US, or is the number just big talk?While US President Donald Trump laid out the figure in public, the Indian government has so far not specified what such a commitment involves, raising questions over its scale, timing and credibility.

Sensex jumps 2,300 points, Nifty surges as markets cheer India–US trade dealThe India–US trade deal has given the Sensex and Nifty their strongest tailwind in months, setting the stage for what could become a far more extended market surge.

Sensex, Nifty today: Will stock market open higher on India-US trade deal?Early signals from the Gift Nifty point to a strong opening. Gift Nifty futures were trading at around 26,190 points at 8:26 am. This suggests that the Nifty 50 index could open nearly 4.5% higher than Monday's closing level of 25,088.4.

Capital gains tax on share buybacks is good for small investors. Here's whyThe government has shifted buyback taxation to a capital gains framework, while tightening rules for promoters who were seen as misusing buybacks as a tax-saving tool.

US, India seal trade deal after PM-Trump call: 5 things that changed overnightInstead of leaving the details to official statements, US President Donald Trump chose to spell out the trade deal himself, framing it as a result of personal diplomacy and immediate action.

Trump announces India trade deal, cuts tariffs to 18% after call with PM ModiAlso shedding light on the much-awaited US-India trade deal, which had faced several roadblocks with New Delhi adamant about not opening its agriculture sector to Washington, Trump said that an agreement is finally on the cards. Trump said he lowered the reciprocal tariffs following discussions with PM Modi, describing the move as a gesture of "friendship and respect."

Budget 2026: 7 key takeaways for individual taxpayersThe Union Budget 2026 may not have changed income tax rates, but it brings several practical updates that affect how individuals file returns, disclose income and deal with compliance. From easier timelines to simpler rules, here are the key takeaways taxpayers should know.

Silver ETF takes a hit: Down Rs 2 lakh, what should investors do now?On the Multi Commodity Exchange (MCX), silver prices have dropped sharply from their record peak, while gold has also seen a strong correction.

Silver prices crash Rs 17,000 today. More correction ahead?After touching record highs in recent weeks, silver prices have cooled sharply. The metal has slipped by nearly Rs 17,000, prompting investors to pause and reassess whether this fall is a buying opportunity or a sign to stay cautious.

entertainment.headline: Malayalam music composer SP Venkatesh dies at 70 after cardiac arrest SP Venkatesh, renowned for his work in Malayalam and other South Indian cinema, died on Tuesday in Chennai at the age of 70 following cardiac arrest. His decades-long career included hit songs and background scores in multiple Indian languages.

Kangana Ranaut disturbed by Epstein files, questions the essence of humanity Actor and politician Kangana Ranaut has said she feels deeply disturbed after reading the recently released Epstein Files, questioning the involvement of public figures and expressing concern about the moral direction of society.

Family Business, Mismatched 4 to Ikka: Netflix India reveals its 2026 slate Netflix marks ten years in India by revealing a 2026 lineup with major stars and new originals, including Sunny Deol-Akshaye Khanna's Ikka, Saif Ali Khan's Hum Hindustani, and new seasons of popular favourites.

Innocence of movies is lost: Jason Shah reacts to Dhurandhar violence, Toxic teaser Jason Shah expressed shock over people enjoying the violence in Dhurandhar. He shared his concern over the audience's preference to see overt violence on-screen.

We were stuck in a cycle we couldn't break: Imran Khan on separation from Avantika Actor Imran Khan opened up about his separation from ex-wife Avantika Malik. He reflected on the need for a healthy, patterned relationship.

The Drama trailer: Robert Pattinson, Zendaya tease love story shaken by dark secret A24's psychological drama The Drama, starring Zendaya and Robert Pattinson as an engaged couple, uses a mysterious confession to unravel their relationship just before their wedding. The trailer's secrecy leaves viewers guessing about the turning point.

Dulquer Salmaan's I'm Game gears up for Onam 2026 release, unveils new poster Actor Dulquer Salmaan marked 14 years in the film industry on Tuesday. On the occasion, the makers of his upcoming film, I'm Game, unveiled a new poster.

Kapil Sharma and team gear up for The Great Indian Kapil Show Season 5 Popular comedy talk show The Great Indian Kapil Show is set to return to Netflix for a fifth season. The Kapil Sharma-led show will feature its signature cast and notable celebrity appearances.

Honey Irani on Farhan Akhtar's divorce from Adhuna: It was a shock Honey Irani opened up on Farhan Akhtar's divorce with his first wife Adhuna Bhabani. The veteran screenwriter revealed how the family was affected by the couple's separation.

Hum Hindustani: Saif Ali Khan's Netflix drama traces India's historic first election Hum Hindustani is a stirring period drama that brings alive the grit, chaos and courage behind India's first democratic election, spotlighting the unsung heroes who helped shape the nation's democratic backbone.

Musafir Cafe first look: Vikrant Massey headlines Netflix's soulful love story The teaser for Musafir Cafe hints at a story of fleeting romances and moving on, with Vikrant Massey, Vedika Pinto and Mahima Makwana in lead roles. Check out more details of the upcoming web series here.

Amaal Mallik was asked why not Arijit Singh over Sonu Nigam for Mere Dholna 3.0 Composer Amaal Mallik discussed the difficulties he faced in selecting Sonu Nigam for the reprised track Mere Dholna 3.0 in Bhool Bhulaiyaa 3. He highlighted wider issues of creative freedom and remuneration in the Hindi music industry.

Draco Malfoy posters go viral during Chinese New Year 2026. Here's why Chinese New Year celebrations in 2026 see a unique trend as Draco Malfoy from the Harry Potter series becomes a symbol of good fortune, with his image appearing on decorations across China due to a play on words in his Chinese name.

Akshaye Khanna, Sunny Deol face off in Ikka; internet says Rehman Dakait is back Netflix released the teaser of Ikka featuring Sunny Deol and Akshaye Khanna in a tense courtroom drama. The teaser has generated attention online with fans showering the two actors with love and praise.

Family Business: Anil Kapoor, Vijay Varma team up for Hansal Mehta's Netflix drama Netflix is set to release a new series titled Family Business, directed by Hansal Mehta. It explores the complexities of power, succession, and betrayal within one of India's largest business conglomerates.

Arjun Kapoor on mother Mona's birth anniversary: Life's been cruel to me lately Arjun Kapoor got emotional on his mother Mona Shourie Kapoor's birth anniversary. He expressed his admiration for his late mother's dignified and graceful persona on social media.

Why BTS' Netflix documentary could be a defining moment for the band BTS returns to the global stage with a Netflix documentary that captures their reunion, growth and the making of ARIRANG. Here's why it marks a turning point for the band.

Chappell Roan defends topless Grammy gown: Don't even think this is that outrageous Chappell Roan defended her daring sheer gown at the 68th Grammy Awards. Her outfit led to outrage from a section of internet users.

Is Sai Pallavi replacing Deepika Padukone as SUM-80 in Kalki 2? Makers clarify The makers of Kalki 2898 AD 2 have addressed speculations around Sai Pallavi replacing Deepika Padukone in the film. The film also features Prabhas, Amitabh Bachchan, and Kamal Haasan in key roles.

general news.headline: Air India, IndiGo flights suffer wing collision at Mumbai airportThe collision happened when the right wing tips of the two aircraft scraped against each other. DGCA officials reached the site after the incident. Air India informed that its flight was waiting on the taxiway for its turn to take off when the incident occurred.

India gets 18% US tariff deal — and a LOT of questionsTrump says the levy on Indian goods drops from a punitive 50 per cent to 18 per cent, and an extra Russian oil penalty will be scrapped. India confirms the new rate, not the full package.

US military shoots down Iranian drone approaching aircraft carrier in Arabian SeaThe Iranian Shahed-139 drone was flying towards the carrier "with unclear intent" and was intercepted after displaying what the military described as aggressive behaviour, US officials said. It was destroyed by an F-35 fighter jet operating from the aircraft carrier.

How India Today Magazine cover featured in Trump's post. Here's the fascinating storyPresident Donald Trump used the cover of India Today Magazine as a teaser before announcing the India-US trade deal. How Trump received the magazine cover from American envoy Sergio Gor, and what followed next is a fascinating story.
Dear Pushpas, a trade deal is a duet, not a duelA bilateral agreement, like the India-US trade deal, isn't about outright victory or defeat. There are gives and takes, and deals within deals.

My name is Mohammad Deepak: How an Uttarakhand shop name became communal flashpointUttarakhand's Kotdwar was recently in the grips of communal tension over the name of a shop owned by a Muslim man-- a controversy that saw the rise of one 'Mohammand Deepak'. With the situation now under control, we trace what exactly went down.

NCP merger talks began in Jan, Sharad Pawar planned handover to Ajit: SourcesThe core of these discussions involved a major leadership shift. Sharad Pawar would announce his retirement from active politics, transitioning into a purely advisory role. In exchange, the Sharad Pawar faction agreed to merge into Ajit Pawar's NCP, granting him complete functional control.

Air India fuel switch cutoff scare: DGCA explains what it foundThe incident, which brought back focus on the June 2025 Air India crash in Ahmedabad, occurred on flight AI-132 before it took off from London's Heathrow airport for Bengaluru.

Why Rahul Gandhi is both wrong and right about Doklam and Chinese tanksHandcrafted ByOur Editors Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi cited an incident of "four Chinese tanks advancing towards Indian positions", saying it was at Doklam in 2020. He was referring to an article based on an unpublished book by ex-Army Chief Gen MM Naravane (Retd). While the Congress leader was correct about the year, when Doklam area also saw Chinese military advance as part of the broader tensions along the LAC, he was wrong about the location. The tank movement was at Rechin La, and not Doklam.

US announced tariffs, US announced cuts: Piyush Goyal slams trade deal criticismPiyush Goyal said that India got the best trade deal with the US when compared to neighbouring countries, spotlighting benefits for farmers, MSMEs, and key industries. He also slammed Opposition disruptions in the Lok Sabha, calling their conduct "disgraceful" during the trade agreement debate.

Dominant Delhi Capitals rout Gujarat Giants to set up final against RCBWomen's Premier League Eliminator: Delhi Capitals crushed Gujarat Giants by seven wickets to reach their fourth consecutive WPL final, setting up a high-stakes showdown against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.
Fog to dominate Wednesday morning, cold wave conditions to continueA new western disturbance is forecast to arrive on February 5, followed by another around February 8.

This missile breathes air: DRDO tests Ramjet technology. What is it?With this success, India enters an elite league of nations that possess ramjet-powered missile technology, a critical enabler for developing next-generation, long-range air-to-air missiles.

What's behind Trump's change of heart for India?Donald Trump's abrupt shift from tariff threats and sharp criticism of India to warm praise for Prime Minister Narendra Modi and a reduced-tariff trade deal has surprised diplomatic and trade circles. What's behind Trump's change of heart for India?

Tremors felt in Kolkata after 6.0 magnitude quake rattles MyanmarA strong earthquake measuring 6 on the Richter scale, originating in Myanmar, shook Kolkata and parts of eastern India on Tuesday night, with residents reporting ground tremors lasting around 15 seconds at about 9:05 pm.

WhatsApp to leave India? Privacy issue that made Supreme Court angry explainedDespite the Supreme Court's stern warning over data-sharing and privacy, WhatsApp is not immediately set to leave India but the coming weeks could decide how it must operate here.

Dhurandhar 2 teaser: Ranveer Singh is back as Hamza with more gore and chaosDhurandhar: The Revenge teaser promises Ranveer Singh in a darker, deadlier avatar. The spy-action thriller, sequel to Dhurandhar, is scheduled to release on March 19, 2026, in multiple Indian languages.

BJP's Y Khemchand to be Manipur CM, to fill post lying vacant for a yearBJP leader Yumnam Khemchand Singh has been chosen by his party for appointment as the new Chief Minister of Manipur, which has been under President's rule for nearly a year now.

Is Trump's US-India trade deal even Trump-proof?President Donald Trump announced that the US and India had agreed to a trade deal wherein tariffs on Indian exports to the US would drop from 50% to 18%. Is any agreement with the US even Trump-proof? Trump acts on whims and fancies, and countries like South Korea, the UK and Canada have seen that trade agreements don't mean much when it comes to sanctions.

Try banning Pakistan: Ex-Pak cricketer challenges ICC over India match boycottT20 World Cup 2026: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali criticised the International Cricket Council, daring it to take punitive action against Pakistan if the team forfeits its match against India on February 15. Ali argued that the Pakistan Cricket Board, acting on government directives, cannot be penalised by the global cricket body.

When Dubai answered to Delhi: The forgotten India–Gulf connectionLong before oil transformed Dubai, the city was closely tied to British India. From Indian passports and the Indian rupee to administrators reporting to Delhi, large parts of today's Gulf were once governed through India. Here's the fascinating history behind that forgotten connection.

Farhan Akhtar will take time to get over 120 Bahadur failure: Mother Honey IraniFarhan Akhtar's mother, Honey Irani, talked about how he's coping with the box office failure of 120 Bahadur. She also commented on his plans to make Jee Le Zaraa.
Our bots spent a day on Moltbook. This is what we foundOur experiment with multiple AI bots suggests Moltbook, the AI-only social network may have been overhyped.

Lok Sabha chaos over Rahul Gandhi's ex-Army chief memoir mention, 8 MPs suspendedThe Lok Sabha witnessed chaos as Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi was stopped from continuing his speech on the President's address, sparking protests and heated exchanges. The incident highlighted tensions over parliamentary rules and India-China relations amid a sharp political confrontation.

sports.headline: England complete T20 series sweep vs Sri Lanka to cap ideal World Cup build-up England completed a 3-0 T20I series sweep over Sri Lanka with a 12-run victory in the third and final match at Pallekele, rounding off their preparations for the ICC Men's T20 World Cup on a high.

Gautam Gambhir ignores question on Pakistan's T20 World Cup boycott vs India India head coach Gautam Gambhir refused to comment on Pakistan's boycott stance against India ahead of the T20 World Cup 2026. Pakistan government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Pakistan will backtrack on India boycott stance in 4-5 days: Former India spinner Ravichandran Ashwin believes Pakistan will reverse its decision not to play India in the T20 World Cup 2026. The ICC has warned PCB of serious consequences if they choose to move ahead with their stance of not playing against the arch-rivals on February 15 in Colombo.

Dominant Delhi Capitals rout Gujarat Giants to set up final against RCB Women's Premier League Eliminator: Delhi Capitals crushed Gujarat Giants by seven wickets to reach their fourth consecutive WPL final, setting up a high-stakes showdown against Royal Challengers Bengaluru.

Snubbed from IPL, T20 World Cup, Steve Smith finds a taker in PSL After going unsold at the Indian Premier League 2026 auction, Australia great Steve Smith has been signed by Sialkot Stallionz for the 11th season of the Pakistan Super League.

Try banning Pakistan: Ex-Pak cricketer challenges ICC over India match boycott T20 World Cup 2026: Former Pakistan batter Basit Ali criticised the International Cricket Council, daring it to take punitive action against Pakistan if the team forfeits its match against India on February 15. Ali argued that the Pakistan Cricket Board, acting on government directives, cannot be penalised by the global cricket body.

Thomas Rew's hundred powers England past Australia into final Captain Thomas Rew struck a battling century as England sealed their place in Friday's Under-19 World Cup final with a 27-run victory over Australia in the first semi-final.

Please don't do this: When Ponting couldn't convince Delhi to retain T20 star Former Australian captain Ricky Ponting said that in 2018, during his time with Abhishek Sharma at Delhi Capitals in the IPL, he urged the franchise's owners to retain the young batter and not let him go.

Fresh trouble for Pakistan: Broadcasters may sue PCB over India match boycott T20 World Cup 2026: More trouble is brewing for Pakistan. Beyond the threat of severe sanctions from the International Cricket Council, the tournament's broadcaster may take legal action against the Pakistan Cricket Board if the senior national team boycotts the February 15 match against India.

New MCC laws explained: 10 rule changes coming to cricket in October 2026 The Marylebone Cricket Club (MCC) has announced 10 major rule changes that will reshape how the game is played, with the new laws coming into effect on 1 October 2026.

GG vs DC Eliminator Highlights: Delhi storm into 4th successive final with 7-wicket win Gujarat Giants (GG) vs Delhi Capitals (DC) Live score, WPL 2026 Eliminator: Delhi Capitals have qualified for their fourth successive Women's Premier League final with a seven-wicket victory over Gujarat Giants in the Eliminator in Vadodara.

Gold medal for chaos: Cricket a glorious mess before much-awaited Olympics returnThe T20 World Cup 2026, featuring 20 teams, was meant to showcase cricket's global future. Instead, it has revived old habits, dragging the sport back into familiar, self-made chaos. With two years to go before cricket's Olympic return, the ICC needs to set its house in order.

Alcaraz was like baby Nadal: Ex-tennis player recalls incredible storyThe Australian Open champion, Carlos Alcaraz, was just 14 when he first left a seasoned top-10 professional searching for answers. More than a decade later, Spain's Davis Cup captain David Ferrer believes that fleeting practice-court moment already carried unmistakable shades of a young Rafael Nadal.

Pakistan shouldn't play vs India, was ICC sleeping before? Former cricketerFormer Pakistan cricketer Kamran Akmal supports PCB's decision to boycott the India match in the T20 World Cup 2026, citing ICC's biased approach. Pakistan's government has denied permission to its cricket team to play against India in the tournament.

Gavaskar trolls Pakistan over T20 World Cup stand: Waiting for their U-turnT20 World Cup: Legendary Sunil Gavaskar has trolled Pakistan over their stand of boycotting India in the T20 World Cup 2026. Gavaskar said that he is awaiting a U-turn that Pakistani players are infamously known for.

T20 World Cup boycott row: What Pakistan risks by forfeiting India matchT20 World Cup 2026: Pakistan could face severe sanctions if it goes ahead and forfeits their match against India. While Pakistan has confirmed participation in the tournament, its refusal to face India in Sri Lanka has opened the door to possible ICC sanctions.

WPL 2026 Eliminator: Gujarat chase first final against Jemimah's CapitalsDelhi Capitals and Gujarat Giants collide in a do-or-die WPL 2026 Eliminator in Vadodara. With a final spot at stake, recent thrillers suggest another nerve-shredding finish awaits.

Tests over T20? Cummins says he did not want to risk himself for World CupAustralia fast bowler Pat Cummins has broken his silence on missing the T20 World Cup. Cummins has explained why he did not want to risk himself in the world tournament.

Karim Benzema joins Al Hilal: How the transfer caused a Ronaldo riot in SaudiBenzema's move to Al-Hilal and Ronaldo's protest have exposed cracks in Saudi football's power balance. What began as squad building has spiralled into a league-wide debate on fairness, control and ambition.

CSK in WPL? Team to start investing in women's cricket, reveals CEOChennai Super Kings are set to invest in women's cricket, confirmed the team's CEO Kasi Viswanathan. Till now, CSK has stayed away from investing in women's cricket despite the advent of the WPL.

Despite thrashing vs Pakistan, Ponting backs Australia to reach top 4 in T20 WCT20 World Cup: Former cricketer Ricky Ponting has backed Australia to reach the semi-final of the T20 World Cup. Ponting has shown confidence in the side, despite the team getting battered by Pakistan in the 3-match T20I series.

Watch: Ishan Kishan cracks up revisiting old viral clip with Rohit SharmaIshan Kishan burst into laughter revisiting an old viral clip with Rohit Sharma, joking about how three missed matches turned into two lost years. The throwback landed just as his red-hot form reignited his T20 World Cup push.

Sky turns blue again: Suryakumar Yadav's timely rise ahead of T20 World CupIndia's T20I captain Suryakumar Yadav was enduring horrendous form in the lead-up to the upcoming T20 World Cup 2026. However, just 1 month ahead of the tournament, the sky has turned blue once again for the India skipper.

ISL picks FanCode over JioHotstar: Value drops from Rs 1.68 cr to Rs 9.5 lakhFanCode has announced as the new broadcast partner of the Indian Super League after beating JioStar in the bidding war. The deal finally clears the way for the delayed ISL season to restart on February 14.

Pakistan pulling off a drama with India boycott in T20 World Cup: HarbhajanHarbhajan Singh has torn into Pakistan's India-match boycott call, calling it staged drama. The former spinner challenged the PCB to hold its nerve and avoid another familiar U-turn at the T20 World Cup.

Why did Ronaldo not play in Al Nassr vs Al Riyadh? Controversy explainedCristiano Ronaldo's unexplained absence from Al Nassr's league clash has ignited strike rumours and exposed growing tensions behind the scenes. At stake is not fitness, but power, ambition, and his future in Saudi football itself.

Legal or illegal? Indian umpire gives verdict on Usman Tariq's bowling actionFormer umpire Anil Chaudhary has declared Usman Tariq's bowling action legal after scrutiny in the Australia series. The decision comes amid debates sparked by Cameron Green's on-field gestures and previous suspicions in the Pakistan Super League.

Sri Lanka back Kamindu Mendis for T20 World Cup, Dhananjaya de Silva dropped from squadSri Lanka have recalled Kamindu Mendis to their T20 World Cup squad despite his modest returns in the format, while the co-hosts have opted to leave out veteran all-rounder Dhananjaya de Silva.

USA send T20 World Cup warning with strong show against India A in warm-up gameUSA delivered a strong performance against India A in the T20 World Cup 2026 warm-up match. Tilak Varma's fitness return and Ravi Bishnoi's performance were the major positives for India in the fixture.

IND vs NZ: KCA acts on inflated water prices during Thiruvananthapuram T20IKerala Cricket Association has launched an investigation into inflated water prices for fans during the India vs New Zealand fifth T20I in Thiruvananthapuram. Several videos and posts circulating on social media showed spectators being charged above the permitted rates at certain sections of the Greenfield International stadium.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
